Detailed Description

A class that handles the opening and parsing of an XML file.

It can be treated as a factory that reads in a single XML file and produces handles to accessing the various section of the XML file parsed.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

XMLHandle::XMLHandle ( const std::string &  fileName,
bool  empty = false 
)

Constructor for the XMLHandle class.

It requires an XML filename to be supplied. The work done is handled by the loadDocument() method.

Parameters:
fileName Full path and name of the XML file.

XMLHandle::~XMLHandle (  ) 

The destructor for the XMLHandle class.

There is an instance count of the XMLHandle class. If this count drops to zero, the XML platform utilities are uninitialised.

Member Function Documentation

DataSectionPtr XMLHandle::getRootSection ( void   )  [virtual]

This method returns a pointer to a DataSection representing the top of the parse tree.

The root section has the prolog, epilog and the Document Element as sibling. Accessing the prolog and epilog of an XML file is done with this method.

Returns:
A pointer to the newly allocated DataSection. A NULL value is returned if there was an error in the parsing or opening of the file.

Implements DataHandle.

bool XMLHandle::isGood (  )  const [inline]

This method returns whether or not this handle is in a valid state.

DataHandle::Error XMLHandle::reload ( void   )  [virtual]

This method will reload the resource from the path specified.

Note: The use of this method may invalidate any XMLSectionPtr and XMLSections pointing to the XMLResource still in use.

Returns:
DataHandle::DHE_NoError if there was no problem, otherwise it returns the DataHandle::Error code.

Implements DataHandle.

DataHandle::Error XMLHandle::save ( const std::string &  fileName  )  [virtual]

This method will save the resource to the path specified.

Parameters:
fileName The path and name of the file to be saved to.
Returns:
DataHandle::DHE_NoError if there was no problem, otherwise it returns the DataHandle::Error code.
